title: Holiday Home Guide: Must-Have Items for Party Hosting
description: The holidays are the perfect time to gather with loved ones, share laughter, and create lasting memories. But hosting a holiday party? author: Tahira
excerpt: Discover must-have items to host the perfect holiday party, from festive décor to essential tools, and create a warm, inviting atmosphere at home!
text: The holidays are the perfect time to gather with loved ones, share laughter, and create lasting memories. But hosting a holiday party? That’s an art that requires a bit of planning, a sprinkle of creativity, and, of course, the right tools to set the stage. Whether you’re throwing a cozy dinner party, a festive cocktail soiree, or a cheerful family gathering, having the right items can make all the difference. To help you deck the halls and dazzle your guests, we’ve rounded up the ultimate holiday home deals guide to ensure you’re fully equipped for the season. 1. Festive Tableware to Wow Your Guests Source: Home With Holly Your dining table sets the tone for the entire event, so investing in festive tableware is a no-brainer. Look for pieces that reflect the season, such as plates with subtle snowflake patterns or gold-rimmed glasses for a touch of elegance.   If you’re hosting a Thanksgiving dinner, you might choose traditional porcelain plates with autumnal colors, while for Christmas, you might opt for plates with red, green, and gold designs.  Ceramic plates with hand-painted details or fine china add a festive feel, while modern glassware can match any occasion. Opt for durable pieces that can withstand the excitement of a lively party but still look sophisticated for formal dinners. To give your table a little extra flair, consider using special serving dishes, such as gravy boats, salad bowls, and tiered cake stands, which allow you to display food attractively. 2. Ambient Lighting for a Cozy Atmosphere Source: Pinterest Lighting is one of the most effective ways to set the mood for your holiday party. Soft, twinkling lights can create a cozy, intimate atmosphere, while bolder lighting adds excitement to the night. Whether you’re decorating your dining room or outdoor patio, lighting has the power to change the entire feel of the event. String lights are a holiday classic and can be used in countless ways—drape them over your mantel, hang them across your dining table, or wrap them around your outdoor space for a magical look.  Candles are another great option—they add warmth and a soft glow to any room. If you want something that feels a little more special, try out chandeliers or pendant lights with seasonal motifs to give your gathering an extra touch of glam. 3. Cozy Throw Blankets For Comfort Source: Pinterest When hosting a holiday party, comfort is key, and there’s nothing better than creating a warm, inviting atmosphere with soft throw blankets. Perfect for draping over couches, armchairs, or even providing a cozy corner for guests to retreat to, throw blankets bring an extra layer of warmth to your space—both physically and visually.  Choose seasonal colors like deep reds, forest greens, or classic plaid patterns to complement your holiday theme. A plush, faux fur throw also adds a touch of luxury that makes your guests feel pampered. They’re especially nice for outdoor gatherings when the evening air starts to get chilly. 4. Chafing Dishes and Food Warmers Source: Wayfair For larger parties, a buffet-style setup is often the best way to go, and having the right tools to keep your food warm is key. Chafing dishes and food warmers are your best friends in these situations. They keep everything at the perfect temperature, so you don’t have to worry about your food getting cold while you’re busy entertaining. Plus, they give your setup a more professional, organized feel. The beauty of chafing dishes is that they come in all shapes and sizes—whether you need a few small dishes for appetizers or large trays for the main course, there’s something for every need. And, if you’re looking for something that adds a bit more flair, go for food warmers with sleek, modern designs or metallic finishes. 6. Cocktail Shaker Set: Shake Things Up in Style Source: Wayfair A good cocktail shaker set is like a secret weapon for any holiday party. Whether you’re serving up martinis, festive punches, or something a little more adventurous, a sleek shaker set adds both function and flair to your bar area. You don’t have to be a professional bartender to impress your guests; a quality set is all you need to stir up some holiday magic.  Look for a set that includes a shaker, strainer, jigger, and stirring spoon—all the essentials to craft your signature cocktails. If you’re feeling extra festive, go for a set with a polished finish or some fun holiday motifs, like reindeer or snowflakes. It’s the kind of item that’s both practical and a statement piece.  Plus, it gives you a chance to get creative with your drinks and wow your guests with something special, whether it’s a spicy holiday margarita or a cozy spiked hot chocolate. 7.Board Games: Bring Laughter and Connection There’s something timeless about pulling out a board game at a holiday party. It’s a simple way to bring people together, spark laughter, and keep the good vibes rolling throughout the night. If you’re hosting a family-friendly crowd, classics like Pictionary or Charades are a no-brainer. They’re easy to play, require little setup, and always manage to get everyone laughing. For a group that loves strategy, something like Catan or Ticket to Ride can draw people in for a competitive and engaging round. And for adults who enjoy a more playful edge, games like Cards Against Humanity or What Do You Meme? can add some cheeky humor to the night. What makes board games special is how they naturally bring people closer. There’s no pressure to be serious—just grab a seat, roll the dice, or draw a card, and the fun unfolds. 8. Holiday-Themed Napkins and Place Settings Source: Pinterest Even something as simple as napkins can add a delightful touch to your holiday décor, setting the tone for your party from the very first glance. During the holiday season, opt for festive, themed napkins that blend seamlessly with your décor.  Whether they feature classic holiday patterns like snowflakes, holly, or plaid, or showcase custom designs with fun holiday messages or your party’s theme, they instantly add a special flair to the table.  Place settings are another area where you can elevate the ambiance. Matching chargers, placemats, and napkin rings help bring cohesion to the table, making it feel well thought-out and sophisticated. 9. Scented Candles To Set The Mood Source: Wayfair The power of scent to set the mood is undeniable, and scented candles are a simple yet effective way to elevate your holiday gathering. The right fragrance can evoke feelings of nostalgia, relaxation, and joy.  During the holiday season, scents like cinnamon, pine, gingerbread, and vanilla can bring that cozy, festive feel to your home. Place a few strategically around your space—on the coffee table, dining area, or bathroom—and let the scent subtly add to the overall atmosphere. Candles also provide that warm, flickering light that adds a calm, intimate vibe to any room. 10. Cocktail Glassware Source: Pinterest A holiday party wouldn’t be complete without a well-stocked bar. Having the right cocktail glassware is essential for serving drinks and adding an element of class to your party. Depending on your drink menu, you may need martini glasses, wine glasses, champagne flutes, and whiskey tumblers. Consider investing in a set of versatile glassware that can be used for various cocktails, from classic martinis to seasonal mulled wine. Opt for glassware with elegant designs, such as etched patterns or gold-rimmed edges, to make your drinks stand out. For a more modern or playful touch, consider colored glassware that complements your holiday décor. 11. Wreaths and Garlands: Nature’s Touch to Décor Source: Pinterest There’s something magical about wreaths and garlands that can instantly make any space feel like the holidays. The best part? Wreaths and garlands are simple but impactful, giving your home that “holiday hug” feeling without overcomplicating things.  You can choose from fresh greenery, which fills the air with a natural pine scent, or opt for artificial versions that still look beautiful but last season after season.  A wreath on your front door not only sets the stage for what’s inside, but it also tells your guests that you’re ready to celebrate. Garlands are just as versatile: loop them around doorways, along your table centerpiece, or drape them across your dining room table for a stunning, festive effect.  12. Holiday Photo Booth: Make the Moments Unforgettable Source: Blog Studio A holiday photo booth is one of those ideas that seems simple, but it adds so much fun to the party. Guests love an excuse to pose for silly pictures, and it’s the perfect way to capture those genuine, joyful moments. You don’t need to go overboard to pull this off—a blank wall with some fairy lights or a festive backdrop works wonders.  Grab a few props like Santa hats, reindeer antlers, and maybe even a “Naughty or Nice” sign. Watching your friends and family laugh while they strike ridiculous poses is half the entertainment. Plus, those photos? They’ll be cherished memories, not just for you but for everyone who came. 13. Holiday Crackers: A Pop of Fun and Tradition Source: Pinterest Holiday crackers are the ultimate icebreaker for any festive gathering. These colorful, festive novelties aren’t just for kids—they bring a sense of whimsy and tradition that guests of all ages will enjoy. When the moment comes to “pull” the crackers, the fun begins. There’s that satisfying snap, followed by laughter as everyone unveils the surprises inside. Whether it’s a small trinket, a paper crown, or a silly joke, holiday crackers spark conversation and a festive spirit. Those bright, shiny paper crowns? They look charmingly ridiculous on everyone, and that’s the point—embracing the joy and silliness of the season together. You can find ready-made crackers in all kinds of themes, from classic red and gold to modern and chic designs, or even make your own to match your party’s vibe. Fill them with items that suit your guests, whether it’s chocolates, mini gadgets, or personalized notes. 14. Holiday Themed Table Runner Source: Pinterest A holiday-themed table runner is one of those little details that can really tie your whole table setup together. It’s such a simple addition, but it has a big impact. Imagine your dining table dressed in a runner with rich reds, deep greens, or shimmering gold accents—it instantly says, “holiday season is here!” What’s great about a table runner is its versatility. You can go classic with one that has embroidered holly or poinsettias, or maybe choose something modern like a plaid design or one with metallic threads that catch the light.  The runner isn’t just decorative—it also creates a base for the rest of your table setup. Place candles, centerpieces, or even a few ornaments along its length, and suddenly your dining area feels so much more intentional and festive.  15. Serving Trays and Drink Dispensers Source: Wayfair When hosting a large party, you’ll want to make sure you’re serving your drinks in style, and nothing does that quite like a good serving tray or drink dispenser. Large beverage dispensers are perfect for punch, lemonade, or mulled cider, allowing guests to serve themselves while keeping the line moving.  Serving trays are equally important for bringing out appetizers, snacks, and finger foods in a way that’s easy to carry around and looks great. Whether you’re serving drinks, food, or both, these items make hosting easier and more elegant, ensuring your guests never have to wait for a refill. Finishing Notes Hosting a holiday party is all about combining functionality with festive charm, and these 20 must-have items are the perfect way to achieve that balance. Let’s make your holiday celebrations truly unforgettable. Happy holidays!
